pages.title: Dockview Panel System
pages.description: Composable panel layout experiment built with Dockview.
pages.body:
# Dockview Panel System

This page links to a working Dockview panel playground.

## What is included

- Add/split panel actions
- Persist/restore layout in local storage
- Simple panel component registry

Use this as the baseline to iterate on your full panel engine.

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.description: Overview of loop-kit docs and how to use this site.
pages.body:
# Getting Started

This docs site is now content-driven.

- Docs pages are stored in `content/docs/pages.json`.
- Admin editing is available at `/docs/admin`.
- You can link a docs page to a registry item for traceability.

## Admin workflow

1. Sign in at `/docs/admin`.
2. Create or edit a page.
3. Publish it and it immediately appears in the sidebar.

pages.title: Registry Overview
pages.description: How docs pages can map to shadcn registry items.
pages.body:
# Registry Overview

Each docs page can include a `registryItem` value.

When present, docs pages show:

- The linked registry item badge.
- A CTA to install from your registry endpoint.
- Optional interactive demo for mapped items.

This lets docs and shadcn registry metadata stay aligned.

pages.title: Roadmap
pages.body:
- DAW and music related components. Could be a whole category! Definitely midi editor, curve editors. A lot of DAW components also work for video editors, animation editors, and more - timelines, layer systems, pause/play/record.
- A whole section for code related blocks/components. CodeMirror editor is neat. But then terminal. Make a whole IDE block. Powering it is beyond the scope of just a UI component library - but so be it. Demo WebVM, Rolldown, webcontainers, remote VMs, etc. Then have a demo for plugin systems. Another idea is a bytecode interpreter for capability handles like the spell game.
- Definitely a shadertoy clone!
- React flow database schema thingy, perhaps.
- Definitely fancy table! I mean really fancy though - like with user scripting, permissions. Coda level tables. More than just tables - have a whole section that's like this. It's UIs for a data +auth system, maybe? Along these same lines: inspectors and serializers for arbitrary data types like objects, numbers, strings. This goes with on-the-fly generated UIs it's important. Auto validation and stuff. Actually key section here - smart views. Think Coda/Notion tables->list->cards->calendar->whatever. This is super important.
- Definitely a keyboard shortcut system that lets you record and remap them and stuff.
- Non-UI stuff that can plug in as data sources or arbitrary "connectors" or sync thingies: PipeDream, for example.
- SVG editor, pixel art editor, keyframe editor.
